text: Hi Louise, There is a production coordinator role at DNEG being recruited for however one of the points is to have proven experience as a Production coordinator. Do I apply for it anyway or should I apply for the production runner role instead?

I would take a shot and apply for the coord role, you are too qualified to be a runner or an assistant. Perhaps reference it in your cover letter and say you acknowledge they have asked for prod coord experience but as you have years experience of project management you feel you would be able to do the role and learn the vfx pipeline quickly. Something like that. There is a shortage of production staff so they should be open to applicants from outside vfx
The company I wo rk for are hiring! Let me know if/ when you have applied and I will put in a good word <https://www.weacceptyou.com/production-assistant-1>
